attributes.action: Stop Physical Education (PE) from being compulsory from Year 9 to Year 11
attributes.background: We'd like to stop teenagers from having to do physical education due to them being self conscious about their outward appearance and to allow them to focus on their GCSEs.

attributes.action: Legislate so no MP serves more than two fixed terms of Parliament or ten years
attributes.background: For decades we have seen a conveyor belt of politicians of all parties that I believe are completely out of touch with the electorate. This petition will provide the vehicle to clear the decks and allow more normal people the chance to make a difference, with fresh thinking and fresh ideas.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 2016, we have seen a direct and deliberate attempt by MP's of all political persuasions, to disregard and dismiss the democratic will of the electorate. 

They were given clear instruction to end our involvement with the EU project. Yet I believe at every juncture they persist with a plethora of reasons not to carry out that instruction. This petition aims to ensure future generations that they will no longer have to put up with career politicians, who seem to think they know better than the people who elect them.

attributes.action: The School Week Should Start On A Tuesday and End On Friday.
attributes.background: Many people may need that additional rest from school whether they're a student or the teacher.

attributes.action: Allow 14-16 Year olds to be payed £4.50 minimum wage
attributes.background: A 14 year old might only get paid around £3 an hour for working in a busy restaurant. This isn’t fair when older people get paid more for doing the same.

attributes.action: Sanction Turkey until military action against Kurd groups in Rojava stops
attributes.background: Military action against Kurdish groups in Rojava must end. Turkey's allies should help the Kurds and not fuel the attackers. The UK must impose sanctions on Turkey until they stop military action against Kurdish groups in Rojava.

attributes.action: Allow a (paid) day off for women on their first day of menstruation
attributes.background: On the first day of a women’s period (menstruation), while some only experience bleeding, unfortunately many experience severe additional symptoms. It is a hard, painful and therefore unmotivating day for those starting their monthly period and already causes thousands of women to take time off.
attributes.additional_details:
Many women, as well as heavy bleeding , get additional, sometimes severe, symptoms such as abdominal and back cramping, headaches, muscle and joint pain, sickness, etc. And additional symptoms, like fainting, due to other health problems like anemia.
Menstruation for many women make school/work days almost unbareable, it is extremely stressful and hard to concentrate. Many women already feel the need to take days off or go home due to this, where they can allow their body to rest.

attributes.action: Require the NHS to notify patients whose test results are at risk of delay
attributes.background: There is currently no system in place to notify patients if their results are caught up in a backlog, and from a personal point of view this can lead to great stress and anxiety.
attributes.additional_details:
It should be part of law/the NHS Constitution to notify patients of notable delays as this can cause distress.
 
According to "Standards for the communication of patient diagnostic test results on discharge from hospital" (NHS England, March 2016), the stress and anxiety on a patient in the delay of the results has been acknowledged, and they claimed "reviews" were being carried out.

attributes.action: Affirm that a ban on smacking children will not be enacted in England
attributes.background:
The Scottish Parliament is in the process of introducing a ban on parents smacking their children.

This could influence Parliament to introduce a nationwide ban. 

Parliament must affirm that it will not restrict parents' rights to decide how to raise their children.
attributes.additional_details:
Assaulting your child is already illegal. A ban on smacking will not prevent bad parents beating their children, it will merely criminalise good parents trying to discipline their kids. 

It would also open the floodgates: will sending a child to their room be false imprisonment? Will taking away their toy be theft? 

Children need discipline and it is for parents, not the State, to decide how to do it. A ban would be unacceptable interference in parents' rights to a family life.

attributes.action: Bring Finland’s ‘National Jealousy Day’ to the UK
attributes.background:
In Finland taxes are made public on the same day. Every citizens tax details are released, everyone will be able to see how much tax everyone else is paying. 
An open approach on tax will show tax dodging, the rich/poor gap, reduce gender pay differences, and much more. 
See additional sources.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2018/11/finland-has-just-published-everyone-s-taxes-on-national-jealousy-day/

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for out-of-school groups to have child protection policies
attributes.background: Having worked in a Faith-based organisation myself and being aware of local groups that do not have child protection policies in place, I am concerned about young people who attend such places. When I have personally approached the leaders of such places in good faith, I have been turned away.
attributes.additional_details: Groups, including faith-based groups such as churches and mosques, which run after-school clubs need to be registered on a database and ground rules need to be put in place by a statutory body to help monitor the progress and implementation of basic rights of the young people who attend places of worship and other groups for religious education or other activities. Some groups are not concerned with the bureaucracy of child protection.

attributes.action: Offer free DNA paternity tests after birth as the standard NHS procedure.
attributes.background: Approximately 20% of the men in the UK who get a paternity test turn out not to be fathers of their alleged children. A paternity DNA check should be offered for free at birth. It should also be offered if a mother claims that someone is the father after some time passes since the birth.
attributes.additional_details: Nowadays it is easy, fast and cheap to make a DNA paternity test. If the paternity test results with a negative result, the man should have a choice to avoid any legal/financial responsibility and owe no alimonies whatsoever, unless he consciously chooses to accept the child as his own (whilst being fully aware that it was conceived by someone else).

attributes.action: Mandatory minimum sentence for shaken baby deaths no guilty plea reduction.
attributes.background: We are calling for a mandatory minimum sentence of 15 years when an offender kills a child through shaking the infant. This should also mean that they are not eligible for the reduction in sentence when pleading guilty to get a lower jail term.
attributes.additional_details: The case of Lee Sweet who pled guilty to manslaughter of his son should serve as a warning that this should never happen again. No family should have to wait a year to lay to rest such a precious life, let alone have to watch as he received a third reduction in sentence for pleading guilty after 11 months of denying it.

attributes.action: Urge the Nigerian Government to release Sheikh Ibrahim Zakzaky from prison.
attributes.background:
Ibrahim Yaqoub El Zakzaky, is a Shia cleric who was arrested & imprisoned wrongfully in 2015  is still being detained despite the Federal High Court ordering his release on the 2nd of December 2016. 

As a result of his imprisonment, his health has deteriorated significantly.
attributes.additional_details:
Thousands of his supporters have been either arrested, abused and even killed for protesting and calling for his release. 

The conditions in which Sheikh Zakzaky has been in are inhumane, and something needs to be done urgently to assist him.

attributes.action: Allow Tier 2 (Intra-Company) individuals and their dependants to settle.
attributes.background: We have lived in the UK for 5 years and are not allowed to settle equally to colleagues on Tier 2 (general). Our parents are paying the same amounts of taxes, and not receiving any government services. It is not currently possible to apply for leave to remain with this visa made after April 2010.
attributes.additional_details: We have a private education and health insurance and aren't incurring expenses from the government. Our employment situation made UK our home, we grew up here and are about to enroll to universities; it is unreasonable to look elsewhere. Our parents are committed to careers in an international company; they will bring back their international earnings to UK to finance our education and settlement. As such, it is a win-win situation that merits consideration

attributes.action: Review how sexual assault victims are treated in court
attributes.background: Sexual assault victims often get ripped apart whilst giving evidence and trying to convict their rapist/the person who sexually assaulted them. This can often damage the victim’s mental health and force them not to come forward and report such things or drop out prior to court.
attributes.additional_details: 80% of sexual assaults are not reported, I believe this is due to the scary court process and being taken through something so horrific. The defence call these victims liars, sluts and retraumatise them all over again. Something needs to change as damaging and destroying a victim of such crime where there is enough evidence to suggest the suspect is guilty to get them off a charge is not the way forward.

attributes.action: M1 motorway must go beyond Berwick upon Tweed
attributes.background: As we now have the M6 motorway on the west coast, going all the way up to the Anglo-Scottish border (i.e. Gretna Green) and then connecting the M74 motorway on the other side of the border, we could now do with having a motorway that goes over the border on the east coast too.
attributes.additional_details: That's why I urge the government to extend the M1 up to Scotland on the east coast as well.  It would mean people travelling from London to Edinburgh or vice-versa would be able to travel not only quicker, but would also reduce traffic on our roads.

attributes.action: Revive the Black Arrow rocket program to put the UK back into space.
attributes.background: From 1969-71, the UK launched a rocket named Black Arrow. The program was a success, but was unfortunately cancelled due to cost issues. Now with new technology and cheaper launch costs, it would be great to see this program revived to provide an alternative launch platform for sattelite companies.
attributes.additional_details: The Black Arrow saw four launches, with one placing the sattelite Prospero into an orbit around the earth. While the rocket saw two launch failures, it eventually ended up succeeding. Unfortunately, the program was cancelled in favour of using the cheaper US rockets to launch sattelites. With the growth of the space industry, and the advent of Brexit, a UK space program is needed. An updated version of Black Arrow will provide a cheaper alternative to the Ariane or Proton rockets used by Europe.

attributes.action: Enable the means to choose whether internet linked activities can be recorded.
attributes.background: I wish a simple, obvious setting to be shown on all devices used to connect to the internet to enable or prevent the harvesting of all data generated from any use of the internet unless required by law. It should be readily accessible to be turned on or off and take immediate effect.
attributes.additional_details: When Google updated it's Terms of Service, I checked what Google had recorded. It had recorded every search I had performed. Worse, the companies I had searched within, sent that data to Google. E.G. if within another company's web-site you click on a Google map, details go to Google. It goes much further. If I use my Android smart phone to take a picture, the software notifies Google! Anything Android processes goes to Google, payments, hotel bookings etc, they get to know everything - why?

attributes.action: Allow 3 wheeled vehicles to be driven on a car licence at 17
attributes.background: In 2013 the law was changed so that 3 wheeled vehicles could not be driven on any licence until the person is 21 i can sort off understand this for motorcycle licences but not car licences

attributes.action: Individuals should pay half the amount of tax on overtime.
attributes.background:
In order to better your financial position and that of your family you should be able to pay only half the amount of tax on any hours worked as overtime compared to what you work as normal hours. 
This arrangement would encourage people into work and boost production and productivity for employers.

attributes.action: Ban estate agents from managing family members’ properties.
attributes.background: After 6 years of nothing but stress due to a "estate agent" who was related/family member to my landlord renting a badly maintenanced property to me. I want a law in place to protect people who private rent from being put in my place.
attributes.additional_details:
I want restrictions that stop relatives who are estate agents/letting agents renting out properties to people for family members.
 
Estate agents make money renting a place out so not only do they make a financial gain themselves but for their family this would be disallowed in other professions as conflict of interest. 
This also gives the issue I had the place was in disrepair and the estate agent was the manager disregarded any laws in place to protect me as a Tenant to help his family.

attributes.action: Ban strobe lighting to reduce the risks of epileptic seizures.
attributes.background: So many people are forced to turn away, close their eyes or even have others to protect them. It also prevents us to do something that normal people can do e.g. concerts. By banning strobes we would be reducing the risks of seizures and enable us to do something that anyone else could do.
attributes.additional_details: Being an epileptic myself, I know how it feels when we're unable to do something with friends or family, to describe it in anyway possible you feel alone. I would love to be able to do specific things such as concerts or horror mazes without having to wear sunglasses or close my eyes. If a seizure does occur in someone because of strobe lighting it can be fatal (SUDEP) to reduce this risk would be a major step forward. Many kinds of symptoms occur from epilepsy such as memory loss and depression.

attributes.action: Require all co.s  to have transparent complaints procedures & call waiting times
attributes.background: Many companies do not want to undergo the trouble and expense of engaging with their customers. Where customers have limited choice, there is limited recourse for customers, who have received a poor service or no service at all.
attributes.additional_details: A flight in July was cancelled by Easyjet. They have not paid compensation that is due. I have called four times and been kept waiting on each occasion more than half an hour, listening to a recording that blames 'unusual call volumes'. On the one occasion I spoke to a human, they explained that the systems were down and terminated the call.

attributes.action: Impose mandatory funeral funding clause upon private pension providers.
attributes.background: When my partner's father passed on, his family struggled to pay the cost of his funeral, in spite of not applying for the funeral funding payout from the job centre, which they were eligible for. We see non-UK nationals work lifelong, only to see their families impoverished by the cost of funerals.
attributes.additional_details: Families of nationals and non-UK nationals that provide an excellent service to the country are often left in a position where they cannot apply for state funeral funding because of the UK benefits system and its applications toward specific situations. Time of death cannot be predicted but private pension pay-ins are lifelong and should fund a funeral, which is the most costly part of some people's lives. The saddest day of one's life should never also be the most internally destructive.

attributes.action: Increase the standard fine and points for driving in closed motorway lanes.
attributes.background: Despite radio ads, we still often see drivers waiting til the very last second to move out of closed lanes with a red X, often passing through a mile or so of warnings. Those caught in the accident and the police/ambulance service are put at risk by the idiocy of people in a hurry.
attributes.additional_details:
The current fines are either not charged, or aren't an adequate deterrent for vehicle users to not use them. Suggested alternatives - as the Highways Authority are informed of where an accident may be and which lanes to close, suggest turning on any cameras available to catch people. The cameras only need be turned on when the lane is closed.

If caught, increase the fine to £150 and 6 penalty points. Alternatively, for each gantry driven through with a red X give them the standard fine.

attributes.action: Stop Fracking Right Away!
attributes.background: Stop Fracking right away or any other drilling’s in the ground for supplies. 17 earthquakes have happened in the last 5 months in Surrey, one just hitting 2 days ago with a magnitude of 3. This never used to happen in the uk! Why can’t we keep UK to be that “one of the safest countries”?
attributes.additional_details: Fracking has proven to cause water pollution and earthquakes in the USA which can have dire consequences. Even if it was safe, should we start becoming less reliant on fossil fuel? They won't be around forever and we need to be prepared for when that time comes. A government survey recently showed that only 16% of people support fracking. We are a country of democracy and should respect the will of the public.

attributes.action: Funding and further research into Metobolic Halitosis.
attributes.background: We all know that Bad Breath is a Social Isolator which creates awkward situations to experience and also to be around. However there is increasing numbers to as much as 3 per cent of the population suffer from metabolism halitosis. This is a mutation in metabolism where sulfur compounds are made.
attributes.additional_details: New findings highlight that a protein called selenium binding controls these compounds however without this leads to increased methanethiol in the blood which releases sulfur compounds in the breath and is uncontrollable. We are asking for further research and funding available to conquer this embarrassing and socially isolating illness to be treatable.

attributes.action: A representation for Wales in the union Jack flag.
attributes.background: 3 out of the 4 countries making the United kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland are currently represented on the GB flag, why not unify the 4 countries equally on the flag to show a true representation of the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no better time than now. The UK are taking back our country with the Brexit in motion. Don't let wales be the forgotten.
Equality 
Equity 
Inclusion 
Together
4 countries

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for councils to provide defibrillators on the high street
attributes.background: Too many people each year Die of not having access to a public Automated External Defibrillator. If these devices were made readily available on high streets, this would save a number of lives and increase the rate of survival or out of hospital Cardiac Arrests.
attributes.additional_details: Each year in the UK, there are 30,000 cases of out of hospital cardiac arrest. The chances of survival if there is no CPR performed and a Defibrillator is not used are very slim. Every minute that passes where someone is not performing CPR and using a defibrillator on a patient in cardiac arrest, decreases their chance of survival by 10% every minute. If a defibrillator is used within 3-5 minutes of cardiac arrest, survival rates jump from 6 per cent to 74 per cent. This is why AEDs are crucial.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to impersonate anyone on social media
attributes.background: There are many accounts on social media that are impersonating people from victims of crimes to criminals to celebrities and the social media companies and government are doing nothing to deter the individuals setting up the accounts.

attributes.action: Legalise the possession of, and right to use cannabis for religious purposes.
attributes.background: The possession and use of cannabis for religious purposes remains a criminal act. Those who use cannabis for religious purposes are currently denied the right to legally practice religious beliefs. The government must respect human rights laws and legalise the use of cannabis for religious purposes.
attributes.additional_details: The Human Rights Act and Article 9 of the European Convention on Human Rights provide the right to have religious belief and to freely practice beliefs. Currently, individuals are not free to legally possess or use cannabis for religious purposes despite supposedly having a right to practice religious beliefs. Members of religions where use of cannabis is permitted, such as Rastafari, are not allowed to use cannabis to practice religious beliefs and the law should be changed to allow this.

attributes.action: Permanently revoke all driving licenses for anyone caught drink/drug driving
attributes.background: Too many people get caught drink driving and are allowed to carry on driving after a short amount of time or just receiving points on their licenses. It’s time to make the streets safer and permanently ban anyone caught under the influence of drugs or alcohol at the first time of being caught.

attributes.action: Introduce a monthly tax raffle to help balance the UKs financial inequalities
attributes.background: Tax payers can opt in to pay £1 a month to a government raffle.  The prize fund is then divided into lots of £20,000 with the number of winners dependant on the pool size i.e. if 31 Million people enter, there are 1550 winners that month.
attributes.additional_details:
Why £20,000? This may not seem a lot for those with wealth, however this is a major amount to the average working person and represents a financial restart we could all use.

Why via tax? Because this ensures each person has only one entry, making it a fair raffle with reasonable chances to win rather than those who have more, being able to obtain more.

No, this does not solve all the problems of financial inequality but its a decent first step.

attributes.action: More funding for mental health awareness
attributes.background: There is not enough funding for mental health awareness. People know too little about it. It should be spoken about more freely, so we don't have to feel isolated and different from everyone else. We are not weird or strange, we are the same just with a different thinking process.

attributes.action: Repeal the hunting act
attributes.background: Although foxes are beautiful to look at we have to remember that for many they are vermin and can carry diseases. Plus the costs they cause to landowners with the slaughter of lambs etc. Foxes will kill chickens, ducks etc beyond what they need at the time. It is something that needs to be managed.
attributes.additional_details: Around 400 members of the Royal College of Vets in London state that fox hunting is the most effective and humane way of managing foxes in the countryside compared to trapping, laying poison or shooting which prolongs the death of a fox

attributes.action: Guarantee the future of Southport & Formby A&E services.
attributes.background: I have heard that the Government may be considering closing or downgrading A&E at S’Port & Formby Hospital. The A&E is a vital needed service; it has saved my life more than once
attributes.additional_details:
Southport is a tourist area with many visitors from around the country. The floral hall also hosts many comedians and shows and this invites more than holiday makers. The nearest hospitals are 15-20miles away approximately adding at least 35 minutes to a journey. Not only is this vital minutes in an emergency, it’s also travelling times for families and friends to visit.
 
The information this petition is based on a flyer from my MP. We had had no notice from elsewhere.

attributes.action: Legalise hare coursing
attributes.background: Hare coursing is a traditional sport and was made illegal. However banning it has led to an increase in offences such as poaching. If it were to be made legal again it would be much more convenient to farmers, police and all others.

attributes.action: Devolve responsibility of railways in Scotland
attributes.background: The Scottish Government should have responsibility for all rail in Scotland. People are fed up of rail fare increases, delays and cancellations.
attributes.additional_details:
Scotland could then have the power to nationalise the railways, if we want to and cap on rail fares.
Scotland must be an equal partner in all agreements for rail than runs from England into Scotland and have full power and responsibility over all rail in Scotland.

attributes.action: Make placenta and cord donation optional at all hospitals!
attributes.background: By donating your cord blood after the birth of your baby you could save someone's life. Any ladies can donate stem cells by giving away their umbilical cord and placenta after you have given birth. Stuff that's usually just put in a clinical waste bin and incinerated really could save a life.
attributes.additional_details: The only issues to this are only certain centres in the UK are using the fairly new scheme.

attributes.action: Allow motorcyclists with a valid CBT (aged 17+) to have up to a 300cc.
attributes.background:
New motorcyclists from aged 17 are forced to ride up to a 125cc and have a maximum power output of 11kw. This is very low and can be unsafe, similar to mopeds as they're normally restricted to 28 MPH.

This limit has been proven unsafe in many circumstances and should be reconsidered.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.quora.com/Are-125cc-motorcycles-good-for-beginners-or-should-one-choose-a-250cc-instead

Although the jump in power might seem ridiculous upon first viewing, but perhaps the government should look at how other countries treat new motorcyclists; along with additional training and theory.

We deserve more freedom and you can learn a lot more with the extra power, making it safer for riders and for them to gain advanced skills at an early stage.

We need more variation upon the market.

attributes.action: Introduce KS2 SATs Science to ALL primary schools
attributes.background: This will help children know more knowledge about science for Secondary School.

attributes.action: New legislation that employers must grant paid time off work for a smear test
attributes.background: The attendance of smear tests is declining year on year however the rates of women in the work place are increasing year on year. A recent review of data shows that a majority of women workers are in low paid and part time work. There is also the issue of zero hour contracts.
attributes.additional_details: Paid appointment leave is at the discretion of the business you work for. Women on a zero or part time contracts are less likely to take unpaid appointment leave or time off work.1 - because this will have a financial impact on them. 2 - this could be the only hours they were offered in the week.3 - their appointment could be scheduled at an unsuitable time - no fault of their own. eg, 3pm women are likely to want to freshen up after a morning at work before attending such appointment.

attributes.action: Make handling food without disposable gloves an offence
attributes.background: This is a petition to make handling food in the food industry without gloves an offence, reasons for this are; its disgusting and off-putting, it increases the risk of spreading germs and catching illness. Its unhygenic and needs to be changed.

attributes.action: Make store return policies more flexible by law
attributes.background: Consumerism is unfair enough to us already, and hugely profitable companies should give us the benefit of the doubt when returning products.
attributes.additional_details: They should not refuse to refund resalable items on the basis that, without a receipt, it may have come from another store. Faith in humanity should be sufficient proof of purchase. Visibly unused products should not be doubted. Store credit is not an option. We need more lenient, flexible return policies.

attributes.action: Reopen the UK embassy in Damascus
attributes.background: After closing the embassy in 2011 due to the war, the British Government should now reopen their embassy in Damascus, the Syrian Capital, as the war draws to a close. Reopening the embassy and restoring ties with Syria could produce cooperation in regards to Islamist terror, and help rebuild Syria.
attributes.additional_details: The restoration of ties with Syria and the reopening of an embassy there would have significant benefits, both for Britain and the people of Syria. We have embassies in all neighbouring countries of Syria, including Iran, Saudi Arabia, and Iraq, and now that Damascus is safe and stable, it's time we restored the British Embassy. Trade, cooperation in regards to terrorism and ISIS, reconstruction, intelligence, and investment could thrive as a result. The British embassy in Syria should reopen.

attributes.action: Introduce anonymous Individual Voluntary Arrangements as law
attributes.background: At present time, if a personal is struggling with debt and want to enter an IVA it is presented on a formal register for as long as 6 years. This disadvantages the persons employment and housing opportunities. See https://www.iva-advice.co/pros-and-cons.html for background.

attributes.action: Renegotiate the Brexit deal immediately in the event MPs vote against it
attributes.background: If MPs vote against the Brexit deal, the Government shall immediatley seek to negotiate an improved deal, including ensuring the U.K. will have a unilateral right to leave the customs union in the event of a backstop scenario thereby honouring the leave vote and working to avoid a “no deal” scenario
attributes.additional_details: The referendum vote to leave is compromised by the inability of the U.K. to unilaterally leave the customs union in the event of a backstop scenario. In the highly likely event MPs vote against the deal the Government must commit to return to the EU to negotiate an improved deal, for example to amend the Withdrawal Agreement to create a unilateral right to leave the customs union in the event of a backstop scenario and to reduce the Brexit bill; to be done immediatley and urgently after the vote

attributes.action: Pause further UK North Sea Oil and Gas Decommissioning Until 2040.
attributes.background:
The UK has already met and exceeded its EU 2030 co2 emissions reduction target of  40% reduction on 1990 levels.
There are 11.7bn barrels oil in existing  UK wells, worth £724.581Bn.
It is irrational to pay $80 per barrel to import a resource that we have. Decommissioning should be paused til 2040
attributes.additional_details:
OIL is and will remain necessary for 60m tonnes per year European plastics industry. Fuel extraction currently supports 320 000 UK jobs.Oil import supply/price is vulnerable to global instability.
sources:
http://www.thenational.scot/news/16059661.north-sea-set-for-oil-boom-as-estimates-are-increased-by-billions-of-barrels/
https://oilandgasuk.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/Workforce-Report-2017-Oil-Gas-UK.pdf
https://www.statista.com/statistics/282732/global-production-of-plastics-since-1950/

attributes.action: Label all ingredients (including soy oil) and create a soy tax
attributes.background: There are many people suffering from multiple food allergies, soy being one of the main culprits. It is hidden under more than 70 different names. I myself have purchased a product labelled 100% turkey and ended up in hospital because soy oil was not labelled. Allergies need to be taken seriously.
attributes.additional_details: I have emailed the supplier of this product and all they have done is acknowledge they had soy oil in the product and offered a £4 refund. This is not enough. I was ill for a month. This is serious. Prepackaged food is over processed and has added soy in for no beneficial reason other than the fact it is a cheap alternative for the manufacturers. There is a sugar tax in action and I think there should also be a soy tax.

attributes.action: Reduce timeframe insurance companies can use expired points against motorists
attributes.background: Insurance companies demand drivers to declare penalty points after the law states they have expired,
attributes.additional_details:
Currently if you receive points that expire in 3 years insurance companies demand to inform them for 5 years. This is just a way to boost premiums. Let’s change the law so that once points expire they cannot be used against you by insurance companies. 
Points valid for 3 years stay on licence for 4 only for court information, a driver should not have to declare them once they reach the expiry date.
